verses.roman:
varaṁ vṛṇīṣva bhadraṁ te
ṛte kaivalyam adya naḥ
eka eveśvaras tasya
bhagavān viṣṇur avyayaḥ

synonyms: varam—a benediction; vṛṇīṣva—choose; bhadram—all good; te—unto you; ṛte—except; kaivalyam—liberation; adya—today; naḥ—from us; ekaḥ—one; eva—only; īśvaraḥ—capable; tasya—of that; bhagavān—the Supreme Lord; viṣṇuḥ—Śrī Viṣṇu; avyayaḥ—the inexhaustible.
translation: "All good fortune to you! Now please choose a benediction from us—anything but liberation, since only the infallible Supreme Lord, Viṣṇu, can bestow that."
